Name: Robowar
Descriptions: In a world where Robots are replacing humans, a first-of-its-kind robo-war seems like just the way to go. Does your robot have what it takes to survive? Let's find out.
Rules: A team may consist of a maximum of 5 participants, all from the same institute or may be from different institute. Participants graduated in 2018 are also eligible for the event
The maximum duration of each round will be 5 minutes the competition will be played on a knock-out basis consisting of 2-3 players at a time
The bot should fit in a box of dimension 50cm x 50 cm x 50 cm
Robot can have the weight up to 25kg (Excluding wires and controls)
DC motors and stepper motors (12V-24V) can be used as per the design of bots
Use of IC Engines in any form will not be allowed
Robots can be built using wheels and tracks

No competitor will be allowed to touch or modify their respective bots until the duel is over. Change of battery will not be allowed during the match

HOW TO EARN POINTS
A robot is declared victorious if its opponent is immobilized (if it cannot display linear motion of at least one inch in a timed period of 30 seconds) or out of the arena

If both robots survive the five minutes at that point, the robot with the higher hit points wins

DISQUALIFICATION CRITERIA
The machine would be discarded if found unsafe for other participants and spectators
All efforts must be made to protect battery terminals from a direct short and causing a battery fire, failure to do so will cause direct disqualification
Working voltages must not exceed 24V DC (mean voltage) at any point of time

Jumping, hopping and Flying is not allowed

    Judges' decision shall be treated as the final
